actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that the Federal Government should refund the part of the contributions which are made by certain officers and employees of the Federal Government to any retirement system for Federal Government officers and employees and which would not be made if the Federal Employees' Retirement Contribution Temporary Adjustment Act of 1983 had been extended.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that upon enactment of a law establishing a new Federal retirement system, the Government should refund the part of the retirement contributions that were made by post-1983 Federal employees which would not have been made if the Federal Employees' Retirement Contribution Temporary Adjustment Act of 1983 had been extended.

titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that the Federal Government should refund the part of the contributions which are made by certain officers and employees of the Federal Government to any retirement system for Federal Government officers and employees and which would not be made if the Federal Employees' Retirement Contribution Temporary Adjustment Act of 1983 had been extended.
